title: 108_hr447
content: The Act titled "Improved Medical Malpractice Information Reporting and Competition Act of 2003" establishes the Office of Health Care Competition within the Department of Health and Human Services. The Office of Health Care Competition Policy is established within the Department of Health and Human Services, headed by a Director appointed by the Secretary. The Office is responsible for activities related to the National Practitioner Data Base and must submit an annual report to the Secretary. Additionally, changes in the National Practitioner Data Base provisions are outlined in the Act. SEC. 3. CHANGES IN NATIONAL PRACTITIONER DATA BASE PROVISIONS. Requiring additional reports on medical malpractice insurance and claims. New section 421A mandates reports on medical malpractice insurance and claims. Entities underwriting medical malpractice insurance policies must report information on insurance and claims for payment. This includes details such as direct premiums written and earned, net investment income, and incurred claims. This reporting is in addition to the requirements of section 421. The report must include data on incurred claims, calculated by adding the dollar amount of closed claims with payment, reserves for reported claims at the end of the current year, reserves for reported claims at the end of the previous year, reserves for incurred but not reported claims at the end of the current year, reserves for incurred but not reported claims at the end of the previous year, and loss adjustment expenses for closed claims. The report must include data on incurred claims, calculated by adding the dollar amount of closed claims with payment, reserves for reported claims at the end of the current year, reserves for reported claims at the end of the previous year, reserves for incurred but not reported claims at the end of the current year, reserves for incurred but not reported claims at the end of the previous year, and loss adjustment expenses for closed claims. Additionally, it should detail actual incurred expenses allocated separately to various categories, net underwriting gain or loss, net operation gain or loss including net investment income, and the number and dollar amount of claims closed with payment by year incurred. The report must include data on claims paid by the insurer during the calendar year, including the dollar amount paid for claims where a verdict had been rendered. It should also detail the number of claims closed without payment, reserves set for each claim, and the number of pending claims at the end of each year. The report must include data on claims paid by the insurer during the calendar year, detailing the dollar amount paid for claims where a verdict had been rendered, including the original verdict amount broken down into past and future economic damages assessed by the trier of fact. The report must include data on compensatory non-economic damages, punitive damages, dollar amounts paid by all parties and insurers, and the number of claims paid by the insurer during the calendar year. The report must include details on the plaintiff's past and future economic damages, insurer's payments for other damages, number of claims paid by the insurer, and specific thresholds for non-economic damages. The report must include details on the plaintiff's past and future economic damages, insurer's payments for other damages, number of claims paid by the insurer, and specific thresholds for non-economic damages. Additionally, it should detail the number and dollar amount of claims paid by the insurer involving punitive damages. The report must include the number and dollar amount of claims paid by the insurer for liabilities found by the trier of fact or estimated by the insurer, excess payments exceeding the insured's responsibility, and any other information deemed necessary by the Secretary for interpretation. The Secretary shall coordinate information reporting under this section with related information reporting under section 421. Additionally, the Secretary must make public file data available for free on the website related to the database established for this purpose, including information reported under sections 421 and 421A. The amendments made by this section regarding information reporting under sections 421 and 421A will take effect 6 months after the enactment of this Act.
